item.title: Shaking Off the Rust 1: Ray Tracing in One Weekend
item.description: WHY: TODO losing touch with low level programming Back in college, my two favorite classes in the undergrad CS curriculum were CSC 236 (x86 assembly), and CSC 461 (computer graphics). Since graduating 10 years ago, and even 6 years prior to that, I’ve been working in web development. Some combination of nostalgia, the retirement last year of my favorite lecturer (Dana Lasher from NCSU), missing low-level stuff, listening to Jonathan Blow wax aggressively about web developers’ lack of deep understanding of computers… sorry, trailed off there.
